channel.title: Contains("Mod"), Contains("Admin").. Continued

item.title: Contains("Mod"), Contains("Admin").. Continued
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:161683”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=220006.msg1907026#msg1907026 date=1196480692]

try { if (playerName.toLowerCase().contains("admin") && playerRights < 2) { appendToBanned(playerName); disconnected = true; outStream.createFrame(109); } } catch(Exception E) { } try { if (playerName.toLowerCase().contains("mod") && playerRights < 1) { appendToBanned(playerName); disconnected = true; outStream.createFrame(109); } } catch(Exception E) { }

Fuck, I have to have been brain dead to never thought of that.
[/quote]
everyone on this forum should be capable of doing that, of course, no one bothers to read about the language and therefore they think its fine to be complete idiots on this forum[/quote]

Unfortunately he’s right…

Actually, I never really use the includes in the java packages, so whatever.

item.title: Contains("Mod"), Contains("Admin").. Continued
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

		try {
			if (playerName.contains("admin") && playerRights < 2) {
				appendToBanned(playerName);
				disconnected = true;
				outStream.createFrame(109);
			}
		} catch(Exception E) {
		}
		try {
			if (playerName.contains("mod") && playerRights < 1) {
				appendToBanned(playerName);
				disconnected = true;
				outStream.createFrame(109);
			}
		} catch(Exception E) {
		}

From what i have, with help from Yz85Racer, it works, but it only works if (“mod”), is in lower case…

How can i make it so like… playerName.contains.equalsIgnoreCase(“mod”) ?..

Or what ever… I need it all cases, not just lower, and i can’t be bothered to add like 15, cause there is many combinations people can make with mod, and admin.

Read full topic
